page.title: 09INTERVIEW WITH A LOCAL
page.content: Mrs Olley has lived in the village of Blofield Heath for 50 years.In the interview we asked her how the area and peoples attitudes have changed over the years.During the interview Mrs Olley explained how the village has changed from a rural village where everyone knew each other to a small town.Although being a rural village they did feel the hardships of the war.They had rationing,evacuees from London and watched the bombings of the main towns.For entertainment people went to social evenings or dances.They never had discos.Young residents played 'valentines'involving uprooting plants from gardens,or they went scrumping.The children played tag, rounders and hopscotch in the streets. We found that Blofield Heath has changed considerably including peoples attitudes and street names.
